text:
It is currently impossible to inline a function call at an particular call sight. (Caller side inlining)
I see that that might cause nasty world age stuff when the inlining is not tracked properly.

AFAIK any time caller side inlining would be possible, it is already a static dispatch.
Static dispatch already sets up backedges.

elements.text:
AFAIK any time caller side inlining would be possible, it is already a static dispatch.
Static dispatch already sets up backedges.

text:
also though, julia’s natural inlining is super aggressive, even without the annotation.
I suspect we might actually want call side no-inlining more
